title: Sunrise host Samantha Armytage, 43, shares a series of snaps of her dog Banjo
text:
Samantha Armytage is the star of the Channel Seven breakfast show, Sunrise.

But on Monday, it appeared the blonde TV presenter had to take a back seat to her adorable Labrador, Banjo.

Taking to Instagram, the 43-year-old shared a series of snaps of the dog as he lazed around the Seven studio at Martin Place.

What happens in the booth, stays in the booth: Sunrise host Samantha Armytage, 43, (pictured) shared a series of snaps of her dog Banjo at Seven studios on Instagram

At one point, the pampered pooch joined Sam in the voice-over booth, with him patiently standing in the confined space.

Sam wrote: 'What goes on in the voice over booth on a Monday morning.'

Another clip saw Banjo sitting down on the studio's floor, with him wagging his tail as he watched the broadcast of Sam and Kochie.

Take your kid to work day: Sam shared a number of snaps, including one that appeared to be taken by a work colleague of Banjo relaxing at the Seven Studios

Thank you for baby sitting: Sam also enlisted the help of co-star Edwina Bartholomew, which looked after Banjo while she was broadcasting

It appears Sam put baby sitting duties on co-star Edwina Bartholomew: 'Thank you for baby sitting,' she captioned the snap.

In a final clip, Sam showed Kochie sitting down, with Banjo quickly trying to take his seat: 'Tough business TV, Always someone trying to take your seat.' the caption read.

This isn't the first time Banjo has made an appearance at Sunrise's studios, or on Sam's public Instagrma account.

Pampered: In a final clip, Sam showed Kochie sitting down, with Banjo quickly trying to take his seat: 'Tough business TV, Always someone trying to take your seat.' the caption read.

Last month, a seemingly innocuous post showing Banjo sparked fury from fans, with many accusing her of overfeeding the puppy.

''What are you feeding him? Lol,' wrote one person, while another added, '(Banjo) Getting well fed Sam!!'

Wrote another: 'Wow Sammy, what are you feeding your dog. He's huge'.

Dog days: What started out as a seemingly innocuous photo of Samantha Armytage's beloved dog, Banjo, quickly turned controversial last month

The photo showed Banjo sprawled out on a couch, with his legs lazily dangling off the side, and his head appearing to be buried against the arm rest.

'Great dog - love labs - he might require less food,' commented one follower.

While another added, 'He looks like he loves his food.'
description: Sunrise host Samantha Armytage is the star of the breakfast show.
authors: Caleb Taylor For Daily Mail Australia
